title: Unhelpful error when using the new module file layout

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given a project layout:
```
project/src/lib.rs
project/src/protocol/
project/src/protocol/status.rs
```

I was attempting to export the protocol module.

```rust
pub mod protocol;
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0583]: file not found for module `protocol`
  --> rust-proto-new/src/lib.rs:13:1
   |
13 | pub mod protocol;
   | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = help: to create the module `protocol`, create file "rust-proto-new/src/protocol.rs" or "rust-proto-new/src/protocol/mod.rs"

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0583`.
error: could not compile `rust-proto-new` due to previous error
```

The extended output makes a similar recommendation.

Ideally the output should look like:

```
pub mod protocol {
    pub mod status;
}
```

This is apparently the style suggested in the docs.
https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/items/modules.html

>  It is encouraged to use the new naming convention as it is more consistent, and avoids having many files named mod.rs within a project.

Here's my compiler verison.
`rustc -V`
`rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04)`
